The Kashi Vishwanath Corridor Project: The expert's verdict highlights the ambitious initiative led by the prime minister Narendra Modi-led BJP government to provide direct access to pilgrims between the Kashi Vishwanath Temple and the ghats of river Ganga. This project involves the demolition of hundreds of houses, for which the government is reportedly providing compensation.
Rediscovery of ancient temples: The expert mentions that at least 40 ancient temples were rediscovered during the clearance process. This aspect adds credibility to the claim that 45 temples were discovered inside Muslim homes that were demolished for the construction of the corridor.
Social media video: The expert notes that a video circulating on social media channels is being shared with the claim that it depicts the demolition of 80 Muslim houses for the construction of the corridor. The video is an important piece of evidence used to verify the authenticity of the claim.
Verification by Kashi Vishwanath Special: The expert mentions that the Kashi Vishwanath Corridor Project is under the supervision of the Kashi Vishwanath Special Area Development Board. The corresponding website of the Board contains a list of properties purchased for demolition. The expert highlights that all the people named in the list are Hindus, indicating that no Muslim homes were demolished for the project.
